Method Detail

allDistances

public static double[] allDistances(int[][] points)
You are given a 2 dimensional array of points. Each row represents one point in the format [x, y] You will calculate the distance between each point and the next point in the array and return a 1 dimensional array containing the distances between each For example, point0 is row 0 and point1 is row1 from your input array. In the array that you return, the element at position 0 will store the distance between point0 and point1. If your input array has n rows, your output array will have n-1 rows. You may either call your working distance method above OR the one that I have provided you below.

Parameters:
points - is a 2 dimensional array of points each with the format [x, y]
Returns:
an array specifying the distance between each subsequent row. This array's length is one less than the number of rows in the input array.

columnContainingLargest

public static int columnContainingLargest(double[][] array)
Given a 2 dimensional array. Return the index of the column containing the largest value Postcondition: do not modify the contents of array

Parameters:
array - is a 2 dimensional array
Returns:
an integer representing the index of the column that contains the largest value

public static double distance(int[] point1,
                              int[] point2)
DO NOT EDIT THIS METHOD, it is used for the problem above. Calculates the distance between 2 points

Parameters:
point1 - is the x and y coordinates of a point stored in an array
point2 - is the x and y coordinates of a point stored in an array
Returns:
the distance between point1 and point2

distance

public static double distance(int x1,
                              int y1,
                              int x2,
                              int y2)
Given the x and y coodinates of two points, call the distance method that has been provided for you to calcuate and return the distance between the points. You are given the points as individual variable values. The distance method is already implemented below, all that you need to do is call the existing method. You MUST call that method to receive credit for this problem. Here is the header definition for the method that you will call: double distance(int[] point1, int[] point2) The distance method requires that the point parameters are provided as arrays where the item as index 0 is the x coordinate and the item at index 1 is the y coordinate. Your task should be as follows: 1) convert the variables that you were provided into 2 arrays of length 2. Each array represents one point 2) call the distance method below to find the distance between the two points 3) return the resulting distance

Parameters:
x1 - the x coordinate of point 1
y1 - the x coordinate of point 1
x2 - the x coordinate of point 2
y2 - the x coordinate of point 2
Returns:
the distance between (x1, y1) and (x2, y2)

emailUser

public static java.lang.String emailUser(java.lang.String email)
An email address has the format username@domain Given an email address return the username portion of the String. In other words, return the part of the string that comes before the '@' character.

Parameters:
String - email address with format username@domain
Returns:
the username portion of the address.

findLongest

public static int findLongest(int[] nums,
                              int target)
Given an array and a target value, find the longest consecutive block of the value target occurring in the array nums. For example, if the array nums contains the values [7, 10, 10, 15, 15, 15, 15, 10, 10, 10, 15, 10, 10] the call findLongest(10) should return 3, the length of the longest consecutive block of 10’s.

Parameters:
array - is an array of integers
target - is the number that we are looking for consecutive blocks of
Returns:
the length of the longest consecutive block of the target value

isValueBetweenRange

public static boolean isValueBetweenRange(int[] array,
                                          int testValue)
This is the same as the previous problem except now we do not guarantee that for the input array the first value will be less than the second value. Given an int array of length 2, return true if the testValue is between the range of the two numbers. You cannot assume that the first value in the array is less than the 2nd value in the array! Precondition: array.length is 2 Postcondition: do not modify the contents of array

Parameters:
array - of integer values of length 2
testValue - the value to determine whether or not it is between the 2 array values
Returns:
A boolean indicating whether testValue is between the two array values or not.

valueIsBetweenRange

public static boolean valueIsBetweenRange(int[] array,
                                          int testValue)
Given an int array of length 2, return true if the testValue is between the range of the two numbers. You can assume that the first value in the array is less than the 2nd value in the array Precondition: array.length is 2 first item in the array is less than the 2nd item in the array Postcondition: do not modify the contents of array

Parameters:
array - of integer values of length 2
testValue - the value to determine whether or not it is between the 2 array values
Returns:
A boolean indicating whether testValue is between the two array values or not.
